Compilation of silent motion pictures produced by Amwerican Mutoscope and Biograph Company.

Films restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.

results.title: Motion and time study
results.creator_credit: University of Southern California and Gil Greene
results.brief_description: Outlines the concept of motion and time study and offers specific exercises for class instruction. Several different motions common to industrial production are presented and then analysed by motion and time study techniques. The motions are again presented, this time without identification, for class recognition and analysis.

results.title: Motion and time
results.brief_description: A study of our relation to time and motion. Depicts the changing concepts of our view of time, motion and space, from Copernicus to Einstein. Principles of Einstein’s theory of relativity are explained through an animated segment, demonstrating that measurements of both space and time are not absolute but are functions of motion.

Principles of Einstein’s theory of relativity are explained through an animated segment, demonstrating that measurements of both space and time are not absolute but are functions of motion.

results.title: Motion and balance
results.creator_credit: Schlessinger Media, First Light Pictures, Olga Palacio, Bob Starner and Tarquin Cardona
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physical science in action”.
Nothing in the universe is at rest. With the Earth spinning and moving through space, everything is actually in motion. The only way we can tell that things are in motion is to compare them to other things nearby. This is called relative motion. This program presents a clear explanation of Newton’s Law of Motion, including the concepts of inertia, acceleration, velocity, equilibrium and momentum. Students are taken on a fun trip to a bowling alley and a golf course for real-life examples to explain these concepts. Also explored is the key idea of net force and how it relates to motion and balance. Suitable for Upper primary/Lower secondary students. Teachers notes included.

results.title: Motion
results.creator_credit: Jack Lieb Productions and Murray Louis
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dance as an art form”
Part of a series designed to introduce dance as an art form. Illustrates how commonplace actions can be sensed and then transformed through selection, arrangement and skillful performance. Narrated by Murray Louis.

results.title: Mothers are people
results.brief_description: Joy is a research biologist, a consultant to a large company. She is also a widow with two school-age children. In discussing her own dilemmas she speaks for many other women. “The powers that be know that women do work, but they turn a deaf ear.” Apart from “discrimination against women,” Joy sees the absence of universal day care as a loss for children too.

results.title: Mother tongue. No. 3. Reading and writing
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Eileen Molony and George Inger
results.brief_description: Part of a series providing an insight into the stages by which young children from birth to 11 years old learn to use, understand, read and write their own language. Deals mainly with the introduction of writing as part of general language development.
